data.title: Untitled Document
data.text:

PROGRAMMING: iHeart Names Mike Preston SVPP For Baltimore; Brett Ballard PD/PMD For ALT 105.3 Norfolk

THE MOUTH, DECEMBER 5TH, 2017 ââ iHeartMedia Baltimore has named Mike Preston as Senior Vice President of Programming, effective immediately. He will also serve as Program Director for 93.1 WPOC. A radio veteran with over 25 years of programming experience, Preston most recently spent time as Program Director of KKWF and KHTP in Seattle, WA. Early in his career he was the Assistant Program Director at ABC Radioâs WPLJ in New York, NY. He later spent 12 years with CBS Radio including three as V P of Programming in San Francisco, CA and nine as Program Director and Vice President of Contemporary Hits Radio Programming in Seattle, WA.

-- iHeartMedia Norfolk has named Brett Ballard PD/PMD host for ALT 105.3, Hampton Roads, VA. He will report to Tias Schuster, Senior Vice President of Programming for iHeartMedia Norfolk. Brett Ballard joins the Norfolk Market from WTKX in Mobile, Alabama, where he most recently served as the Program Director. He also programmed WRKH in Mobile, Alabama and WFFX in Hattiesburg, Mississippi for iHeartMedia. He began his career in Tampa Bay at WXTB with iHeartMedia. âIâm looking forward to the incredible opportunity to lead the new ALT 105.3 and work with some of the best in the industry,â said Ballard. âIâm grateful to the Mobile team for their support over the last few years, and am excited to join the iHeart team in Norfolk.â

ON-AIR: WKYS Wash. DC Adds Khalia Canty To Nights/Weekends

THE MOUTH, DECEMBER 5TH, 2017 ââ WKYS 93.9 FM announced that Khalia âLittle Bacon Bearâ Canty will be the new night show host, effective Monday, November 16, 2017. Little Bacon Bear will bring a new fresh sound and style to 93.9 WKYS Weeknights from 7:00 p.m. to midnight and weekends from 6:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m. with features that include her Bacon Challenge, KYS Verses, Man Crush Monday and Woman Crush Wednesday.

Canty said, âIâm really excited to be a breath of fresh air to not only the radio but to the entire DMV. Thereâs so much talent in the city and this is just the platform to shine some light on that. I canât wait to tell the stories of everyday people. I canât wait to bring listeners more of the best content from the artists they love. I canât wait to turn up with them every night!â She continues, âA special thank you to the entire Radio One family that has been so inviting and helpful during this transition."

SYNDICATION: D.L. Hughley Inks Multi-Year Extension With Reach

THE MOUTH, DECEMBER 5TH, 2017 ââÂ D.L. Hughley has inked a new multi-year agreement for his nationally syndicated radio show with Reach Media. In making the announcement, D.L. stated, âI'm excited that my radio show continues to grow on a national basis, but the honesty and interaction with my audience make it the âbiggest local and personal show in radio.â Extending the relationship with Reach Media gives me the opportunity to address what's important to people I care about in an entertaining, but meaningful way - making a difference in their day!â

Urban Oneâs CEO of Radio Oneâs stations and Reach Media, David Kantor added, âAs one of the most important voices in radio, D.L. is totally in tune with what the African-American listener wants addressed Â­Â­â and to be said. Heâs established himself as the voice, with a humorous edge, but conviction and sensibility to stimulate a dialogue.â The broadcast and digital company noted that Hughley, who established himself as a leading voice in the community, has dominated the afternoon drive-time slot with double-digit rating shares taking key affiliate radio stations to #1 or dominant positions in the market for his target listener demographic with The D.L. Hughley Show."

George Toulas Named VP/MM FOR Beasley Tampa Cluster

THE MOUTH, DECEMBER 5TH, 2017 ââ Beasley has named George Toulas its Market Manager of the companyâs cluster of six radio stations in the Tampa, Florida market, including: WHFS-AM 1010, WPBB-FM 98.7, WLLD-FM 94.1, WQYK-FM 99.5, WRBQ-FM 104.7 and WYUU-FM 92.5. Toulas most recently served for the past five years as the Director of Sales and Operations of Apricot Lane USA. Previously, Toulas was the Executive Vice President of Operations and Sales for Clear Channel/iHeartMedia in San Antonio, Texas. In addition, he held the positions of President and Market Manager at iHeartMedia in Miami, Director of the New Music Division at Salem Communications in Camarillo, California and Senior Vice President of American Media, Inc. in New York City.

It feels really good to come back to Radio,â said Toulas. âI am excited to join Beasley Media Group in Tampa, where the clusterâs fabulous team will keep the winning tradition alive and well.â He replaces Kent Dunn, who recently transferred to oversee Beasley Media Groupâs Augusta-based cluster of radio stations.

FORMATICS: Entercom Flips From Country To Soft-Rock In Seattle; Hubbard Drops Rock For Country

DeAnna Lee Moves 100.7 The Wolf

THE MOUTH, DECEMBER 5TH, 2017 ââ Entercom announced the launch of The New 94.1 The Sound, Seattleâs new soft rock radio. âThe New 94.1 The Sound will provide the Seattle audience with a unique and relaxing radio experience that is curated with the Puget Sound listener in mind,â said Pat Paxton, Entercomâs President of Programming. âWe are excited to fill this void in radio in Seattle and offer avid music fans a fresh new sound they can enjoy at work or as they go about their day.â The Sound replaces KMPS-FM Country Music Radio and as part of the change, host DeAnna Lee will be joining 100.7 The Wolf. âWe recognize and respect all of the people who have been involved with KMPS station and its rich and long history in the country format,â continued Paxton. âWe are committed to continuing to provide the very best country station with our entire team on 100.7 The Wolf. We are also excited to welcome back Deanna Lee to middays on 100.7 The Wolfâ.

-- No sooner had Entercom flipped to Soft-Rock, Hubbard Radio Seattle announced it was flipping it rock-formattedKVRQ to new Country 98.9 FM, âNobody Plays More New Countryâ. âWe at Hubbard Radio Seattle are looking forward to winning the Country war in Seattle. With a live and local Hubbard Radio mantra, itâs going to be a whole lot of fun building one of Americaâs great country radio stations.â âNow we are ramping up on staff hires including a Program Director.â stated Marc Kaye, Hubbard Radio VP/Market Manager Seattle.

Radio 105.7 Atlanta Changes Name To ALT, Keeps Same Format And Lineup

THE MOUTH, DECEMBER 5TH, 2017 ââ On Monday night, Radio 105.7 changed its name to Alt 105.7, but the format and lineup remain intact. The AJC's Rodney Ho says the line-up appears to be the same with Wendy Rollins in mornings, Knox mid-days and Aly Young in afternoons. âWeâre changing things up but weâre still here,â Rollins said this morning. The music sounds the same, a mix of alt rock going back to the 1990s when 99X reigned.

IHeartRadio made the official flip on March 28, 2013, when it changed from a rhythmic top 40 format Wild. The station has focused been heavily music focused. According to HO, in the most recent October ratings book, it ranked 11th with a 4 rating with 18 to 34 year olds and 19th overall with a 1.6 rating.

Entercom Returns WBMX Calls to Chicago; Mix Boston Becomes WWBX

THE MOUTH, DECEMBER 5TH, 2017 ââ Entercom shared new call letters for Bostonâs Mix 104.1. The heritage hot adult contemporary radio station will now go by WWBX-FM. MIX 104, home to The Karson & Kennedy Show (Karson shown far right), will remain in the same format.

Meanwhile, after twenty six years as WBMX-FM, the station will return the call letters to its original station in Chicago, IL. Classic Hip-Hop WJMK-FM/104.3.

.

CMG To Simulcast 'Rare Country Awards'

THE MOUTH, DECEMBER 5TH, 2017 ââ Rare Country has teamed up with Cox Media Groupâs (CMG) country stations to simulcast the Rare Country Awards concert event live from Nashville on Thursday, December 14 at 9 pm ET/8 pm CT. The concert will reveal the winners of the 2017 Rare Country Awards, and feature performances by nominees Kane Brown, LANCO and RaeLynn.

Midday host Christi Brooks of The New 93Q Houston and morning co-host JR Jaus of Y100 San Antonio (shown left) have been tapped to host the one-hour concert, simulcasting from ACME Feed & Seed in downtown Nashville. The event will livestream on RareCountry.com, and Rare Countryâs Facebook page, and simulcast on these CMG country stations: KKBQ (93Q) Houston, KCYY (Y100) San Antonio, WWKA (K92.3) Orlando, KWEN (K95.5) Tulsa, WHKO (K99.1) Dayton and WNGC/WTSH Atlanta/North Georgia.

Laurissa Phillips, General Manager, Rare Country, said: âTapping into the promotional power of CMG stations is a tremendous asset for us, and weâre thrilled to welcome Christi and JR to Nashville for the live show. Their energy and format expertise make them ideal hosts for the livestream and simulcast.â Voting is currently underway at RareCountryAwards.com and runs through Wednesday, December 13.

NETWORKS: WWO News Producing Two Long-Form 'Year In Review' Specials

THE MOUTH, DECEMBER 5TH, 2017 ââ Westwood One News is producing two long-form Year in Review programs for stations: The Year in Review â The Big Stories, anchored by First Light host Evan Haning; and The Year in Review â People, Sports and Entertainment, anchored by America in the Morning host John Trout. Both The Year in Review half-hour specials and the 20-part series are available to Westwood One News affiliates and Cumulus stations.

The Year in Review - The Big Stories will take a look back on the first year of Donald Trumpâs presidency, from the Inauguration, cabinet and staff shake-ups, and the Russian collusion investigation to efforts to repeal Obamacare and enact tax reform. Additional stories include natural disasters caused by hurricanes and fires, as well as mass shootings and a terrorist attack. The Big Stories will also look at the mounting sexual harassment scandals and other big stories that made news in 2017. The Year in Review - The Big Stories will run the weekend of December 23-24 and replaces The Week in Review.The Year in Review and/or the 20- part series of one-minute reports, contact Jim Jones at jimjones@westwoodone.com or (202) 840-7933.

Former WNYC Host John Hockenberry Hit With Sexual Harassment Accusations

THE MOUTH, DECEMBER 4TH, 2017 ââ Former WNYC radio host John Hockenberry who aired 'The Takeaway' has been accused of sexually harassing several female co-workers, according to The New York Post. Kristin Meinzer, a producer for Hockenberry, recalled a moment in 2014 when she scored him an interview with Oscar-winning actress Marion Cottillard. Meinzer claims Hockenberry responded with unwanted kisses. âHe rolled right up to me at my desk, grabbed my face and started kissing me,â Meinzer said. âI moved my head away and pushed him away, and I said, âNo, no, please donât.â âHe responded, according to Meinzer, âI just want to kiss you because Iâm so thankful.â She said no: âA hug is fine, but I donât want to be kissed.â There were claims by others, as well.

In statement through his publicist, Hockenberry didnât deny any of the allegations. âLooking back, my behavior was not always appropriate and Iâm sorry,â he said. âIt horrifies me that I made the talented and driven people I worked with feel uncomfortable, and that the stress around putting together a great show was made worse by my behavior.â Hockenberry, who has been in a wheelchair since he was struck by a car at age 19, seemed to blame his disability for his bad behavior. âHaving to deal with my own physical limitations has given me an understanding of powerlessness, and I should have been more aware of how the power I wielded over others, coupled with inappropriate comments and communications, could be construed,â he said. âI have no excuses.â PHOTO/NPR - Eileen Koteras Elibol

'Prairie Home Companion' Gets A New Name

THE MOUTH, DECEMBER 4TH, 2017 ââ âA Prairie Home Companionâ has been renamed âTown Hall,â just days after its longtime host, Garrison Keillor, was accused of sexual misconduct reports Reuters. Chris Thile, the mandolinist who took over as host of the long-running show last year, announced the name change on Saturday from the Town Hall, the New York City theater where it is staged before a live audience. In opening the first episode since Minnesota Public Radio ended its business relationship with Keillor, Thile called Keillorâs dismissal âheartbreaking newsâ and linked it to other prominent men in politics, media and entertainment who have been accused of sexual harassment or assault. âAs for this show, I want it to be a place for us to gather around, hear great music, laugh together, reflect and gain respite from our weekly troubles,â Thile said. âAnd Iâm as thrilled as ever to say: âComing to you live from New York City, welcome to âTown Hall.'â A spokesman for the show did not respond to questions on Sunday. After his firing, Keillor, 75, said in an email to the Minneapolis Star Tribune that he had accidentally touched the bare back of a woman with whom he had worked and that he later sent a note apologizing to her after seeing her recoil.

PROGRAMMING: Jim Fox Named VP/Music Programming For Entercom Dallas/Ft. Worth

THE MOUTH, DECEMBER 4TH, 2017 ââ Entercom announced the appointment of Jim Fox as VP/Music Programming for the Dallas-Fort Worth cluster effective December 21, 2017. Fox joined Entercom Sacramento in 2003 and will continue in his current role as Vice President of Programming in the Sacramento cluster until the end of the year. In addition, Jim will serve as Program Director for KJKK, JACK FM and KVIL ALT 103.7, which launched its Alternative format under Jimâs direction in Dallas on November 17, 2017. âJim has guided the alternative format for RADIO 94.7 and 98 Rock to exceptional ratings performance in Sacramento,â said Brian Purdy, Regional President and Market Manager, Entercom Dallas-Fort Worth.

âItâs an underestimation to say that this is an exciting time to be a part of Entercom,â commented Jim Fox. âIâm honored and extremely proud to have the good fortune to leave one incredibly successful Entercom cluster to join another incredibly successful Entercom cluster in Dallas under the leadership of Regional President and Market Manger, Brian Purdy.â

iHeart Names Ashley Wilson PD For WNOE New Orleans; 'Java' Joel Murphy PD For WAKS-FM/Cleveland; Keith Abrams Adds PD Stripes For WMMS-FM

THE MOUTH, DECEMBER 4TH, 2017 ââ iHeartMedia has named Ashley Wilson Program Director for 101.1 WNOE, New Orleans. In addition, Wilson will handle PM drive. Wilson will report to Angela Watson, SVP/Programming for iHeartNew Orleans. âWeâre so excited to have Ashley join our New Orleans team,â said Watson. âShe has an amazing background that ranges from on-air hosting to social media and Iâm confident that sheâs going to make a huge impact at 101.1 WNOE.â Wilson joins iHeart New Orleans from WGNE-FM in Jacksonville, FL.

--In other iHeart moves, it named 'Java'' Joel Murphy (L) PD for its WAKS-FM/Cleveland. Along with the move, SVP/Programming for the North Ohio Region Keith Abrams is named Program Director for WMMS-FM. Murphy most recently served as KISS FM's Assistant PD/Music Director and afternoon host. "Joel knows great radio and has been an important part of KISS FM for more than 10 years," said Keith Hotchkiss, President of iHeart's North Ohio Region. "I'm excited for him to lead KISS FM's strategic and creative direction. We're ready for him to take the station to the top of the Terminal Tower." "Being handed the keys to program 96.5 KISS FM is a dream come true," said Murphy. "I couldn't be more excited for this opportunity after being part of the brand for over a decade!"

ON-AIR: Toby Knapp Named Morning Co-Host For WASH-FM;' Kelly Urich Debuts On KCMO-FM Kansas

THE MOUTH, DECEMBER 4TH, 2017 ââ â iHeart Washington, D.C. announced that Toby Knapp has been named as the new co-host for the morning show on 97.1 WASH-FM, Washington. Knapp will join current co-host Chilli Amar.

Knapp joins WASH-FM from iHeartMediaâs HOT 99.5, DC where he spent eleven years hosting the af ternoon drive show and serving as Assistant Program Director. He will continue his afternoon show on HOT 99.5 through the end of the year. âAfter over a decade on Hot 99.5 in afternoons, itâs an honor to be given the chance to co-host mornings on D.C.'s monumental 97.1 WASH-FM,â said Knapp -- Iâm beyond excited that Chilli Amar and I have the opportunity to bring something truly magical and unique to our nation's capital.â

-- Cumulus Media announces that it has tapped long-time Kansas City radio personality Kelly Urich to anchor mornings on Classic Hits station 94.9 KCMO-FM in Kansas City. âKelly Urich Morningsâ debuts on 94.9 KCMO on Tuesday, December 26, and will air weekdays from 6AM-10AM. Urich has been a Kansas City radio fixture or 28 years and is a two-time Kansas City Radio Personality of the Year. He was formerly with KZPT after many years with KMXV.

EXECUTIVE ACTION: Kent Dunn Returns To Augusta To Lead Beasley Cluster

THE MOUTH, DECEMBER 4TH, 2017 ââ Beasley announced that Kent Dunn will return home to once again oversee the companyâs cluster of eight radio stations in the Augusta, Georgia market. Dunn most recently served as Vice President and Market Manager of Beasleyâs cluster of radio stations in Tampa, Florida. The radio veteran previously held the role of Vice President and Market Manager of companyâs cluster of radio stations in Augusta, GA. He joined Beasley in 1991 and worked in the Augusta market as general manager and/or market manager from 1993-2014.

âI am very grateful to the Beasley family for providing me with the opportunity to move back home near my family and once again lead the companyâs Augusta-based stations,â said Dunn. âI look forward to working with Mark and the clusterâs outstanding team in expanding our presence in the community.â Former Vice President and Market Manager Mark Haddon will shift his responsibilities to become Director of Sales to focus on the clusterâs overall sales effort.

FORMATICS: 93.9 LITE-FM Returns To Chicago

THE MOUTH, DECEMBER 4TH, 2017 ââ iHeartMedia Chicago announced the return of the heritage station brand 93.9 LITE FM. The station, previously 93.9 MYfm, will continue its regular programming and shows with music from 80âs artists. On-air personalities Kristina Kage, Robin Rock and Mick Lee will continue to host the stationâs programming.

âBased on our extensive research, the iconic brand of 93.9 Lite FM resonates tremendously with Chicagoans,â said Matt Scarano, President of iHeartMedia Markets Groupâs Chicago Region. âHence, we have decided to give Chicago back one of its favorite radio brands. We are proud to turn the Lite back on in Chicago and re-brand 93.9 with its familiar moniker. After Christmas music concludes, 93.9 LITE FM will continue to play the best variety from the 80âs, 90âs and now.â

SNAPS: WINS/New York's Lee Harris Keynotes At Estabrook Service Awards

THE MOUTH, DECEMBER 4TH, 2017 â The 57th annual Hofstra University George M. Estabrook Distinguished Service Awards were presented on Saturday, December 2nd, 2017. One of the highlight of the evening was guest speaker Lee Harris, Morning Drive News Anchor of 1010 WINS, NY, who shared the many important lessons he learned as a young community volunteer broadcaster during his time at Hofstra's radio station, now WRHU -- then WVHC. Harris' Keynote and Service Award was presented alongside 7 Hofstra Alumni honorees, who all represented Distinguished Service to their communities while also having distinguished themselves in their different careers.

In addition to it's annual service awards, the Hofstra George M. Estabrook Alumni Association supports an annual scholarship at the University for students who are involved in community service while maintaining academic achievement. For more information on the Hofstra University Estabrook Alumni Association please visit HERE The Estabrook Alumni Association will begin accepting nominations for the 2018 awards after January 1, 2018.

SHOWN L-R: Harvey Nagler, Sue Zizza, President of SueMedia Lee Harris, Morning Host at 1010 WINS, Entercom, Heather Cohen, EVP, The Weiss Agency, Ben Mevorach, Director of News and Programming, 1010 WINS, Entercom PHOTO/Steve DiMaio

EVENTS: Magic 106/Boston 76th Annual Tree Lighting; WJRZ/New Jersey Fills 50 Foot Pepsi Truck; BIG 98.7 Jesse & Amanda's BIG Christmas Break In

THE MOUTH, DECEMBER 4TH, 2017 ââ MAGIC 106.7 Kicked off the Holiday Season in Style with the 76th Annual City of Boston Tree Lighting Boston, MA (12/1/17): WMJX-FM, Bostonâs Christmas Station, once again served as the proud sponsor of the 76th Annual City of Boston Tree Lighting. MAGIC 106.7 Personalities David OâLeary and Nancy Quill emceed the annual festivities (shown top left with Kara DioGuardia) . The tree lighting was broadcast live on WCVB-TV Channel 5 with over 15,000 people in attendance. Santa and Boston Mayor Marty Walsh flipped the switch to light up Bostonâs Official Christmas Tree, commemorating 100 years of friendship with The Province of Nova Scotia. The event featured performances from All 4 One, Kara DioGuardia from American Idol, the cast of Elf the Musical

Beasley's shared that during its recent 100.1 WJRZ âShare the Joyâ live radio broadcast, community members helped to fill a 50-foot tractor-trailer with donations of food, clothing, and new, unwrapped toys at Perlmutter Family ShopRite in Toms River to benefit Ocean County Hunger Relief and Big Brothers Big Sisters of Ocean County. The drive totaled $1,832 in cash and checks; $275 in gift cards; 13 pallets of food; 20 of turkeys; 13 pallets of clothing; and 375 toys. âYear after year, 100.1 WJRZ's listeners come through for local families in need at the holidays during our "Share the Joy" broadcasts, and 2017 was no exception,â said Matt Knight (shown top right), program director and afternoon drive host of 100.1 WJRZ-FM. âKnowing that the donations benefited their Ocean County neighbors is a driving force behind this food/toy/clothing drive for our listeners.

Finally, there's Big 98.7âs Jesse and Amanda with Pike in the Morning pulled off a 'BIG Christmas Break In' for a local family in need! Tosha Perron lost her husband last month, unexpectedly, one month before his 33rd birthday. When Jesse and Amanda found out, they wanted to help her and her three kids (all under 10). They went out, bought a tree, decorations, presents for the kidsâ¦wrapped them allâ¦poorlyâ¦and with the help of her friends âbroke intoâ her house when she wasnât home! When she got home with her kids, they found a fully decorated tree, a bunch of wrapped presents for the kids, a $500 Visa gift card for mom and Jesse and Amanda with Pike in the Morning waiting for them!
